g.text: Cl Studied by First Principle Calculations
State Key Laboratory of Structural Chemistry, Fujian Institute of Research on the Structure of
Matter (FJIRSM) Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS), Fuzhou 350002, China
Max-Planck-Institute for Solid State Research, Heisenbergstr. 1, D-70569 Stuttgart, Germany
Received: 21 June 2019; Accepted: 19 July 2019; Published: 23 July 2019
First-principles calculations based on the density functional theory (DFT) were carried
out to study the atomic structure and electronic structure of LiAl
Cl, the only material in the
layered double hydroxide family in which delithiation was found to occur. Ab initio molecular
dynamics (AIMD) simulations were used to explore the evolution of the structure of LiAl
during a thermally induced delithiation process. The simulations show that this process occurs
due to the drastic dynamics of Li
at temperatures higher than ~450 K, in which the [Al
host layers remain stable up to 1100 K. The calculated large value of the Li
, at 500 K and the high stability of the [Al
technical application of the partially-delithiated Li
Layered double hydroxides (LDHs) are found among clay minerals or as synthesized
materials, which are composed of positively charged brucite-like layers and anions between
these layers. Extensive studies show that LDHs have important applications in catalysis [
], etc. Generally, thechemical formulaof LDHs canbewritten

layers are completely occupied by monovalent Li
are the only known cases of M
